newsitem.title: UK: KBC, three others set debut premiums.
newsitem.headline: KBC, three others set debut premiums.

text.p: Spring reached the new issues market on Thursday as four companies' shares began trading on the London Stock Exchange.

Shares in all four companies - oil industry consultant KBC Advanced Technologies, accounting software house London Bridge Software, continental foods importer Donatantonio and office planner Total Office Group - set a premium on their first day of trading.
By 1435 GMT KBC Advanced Technologies shares were quoted at 247-1/2p, ahead of their 195p issue price in a placing raising 34.2 million stg and valuing KBC at 89.0 million.
"The listing will provide us with more flexible funding opportunities and will further raise our profile in the international markets we serve," said KBC chairman Richard Davies.
London Bridge Software's shares were quoted at 260-1/2p, setting a premium to their issue price of 200p in a placing which raised 12.0 million stg and valued the company at 47.0 million stg.

Shares in Donatantonio, an importer and distributor of Italian foods based in north London, were quoted at 71-1/2p. The company said the shares were issued at 70p by Fiske & Co in a placing raising 3.15 million stg.
Total Office Group was the only one of Thursday's new issues to float on the Alternative Investment Market, the stock exchange said.

Total Office's shares were quoted at 152-1/2p, although no trade was registered in the stock. The shares were placed at 145p in an issue raising 7.0 million stg, the company said. At the placing price, Total Office was valued at 25.0 million stg.
